page.title: 02INDUSTRY IN CULLOMPTON
page.content: 50 years ago industry was varied;leather_tanning,weaving,manufac ture of gloves,jam,bricks and paper.Now only the papermill remains open,employing 100 people,whilst population has doubled.A new industrial estate has been built,but despite motorway access little new industry has been attracted,and what has come is mechanised and not labour intensive.Perhaps tourism could be developed.Locally employed people work in services or farming.Others commute to{Exeter.}Difficulty in finding jobs is increasing for children leaving school.This year of 151 leaving school 15% found jobs,45% go to further education,30% on training schemes and 10% straight on the dole.
